lexUnit.name: pity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the feeling of sorrow and compassion caused by the sufferings of others

sentence.text: She had seen the pity in her mother 's eyes and a great rage against Janine had rushed through Maura .
There was a queer pity in his voice .
He was nearly fifty and Kate could see the pity in his eyes .
She could n't bear that , could n't stand to see pity in those dark compelling eyes .
The Perm was soon taking pity on Charlie , as people tended to , and Charlie was asking him about the pressures of fame as if it were something that concerned him from day to day .
People like feeling pity for people , it makes them feel lucky .
Flora , who was one of the people who had never seen a naked man , was filled with an immense pity for Freddy Ward .
Mr Cottle looked up , his eyes beseeching Mary Ann to find another object for her well-meaning pity .
` I do n't need your pity , Caroline . "
` Do n't be sorry for me , I do n't want your pity ! "
Self pity set in and so did eating binges .
One moment Churchill had been lost in self pity , the next caught up in the thrill of trying to outwit Goebbels and even his own sea defences , yet now he was shedding tears .
Henry pursued with admiring pity .
He thought with pity of her future , as he knew her marriage to Troy could not be happy for long .
My subject is War , and the pity of War
People like feeling pity for people , it makes them feel lucky .
Overcome with pity for her , he exclaimed , ` What are the sufferings of us men compared to that terrible pain which women have to bear during childbirth ? "
What a pity about Dr Neil 's ruined face -- and his suspicious manner , were her last conscious thoughts before sleep took her .
With a mixture of admiration at her own acumen , pride in her country , and affectionate pity for Omi , Erika politely sat upright as the Minister began his sermon .
She looked at his clothes with disbelief and a little pity .
He is harsh and shows little pity in dealing with the fallen angels and his exclamation that his son will be exalted resounds with a rather curt and slightly arrogant ring .
The man had pity for me and I shot him ! "
Apparently the servant girl he married squandered every penny of his and Elizabeth says she has no pity for her now she 's destitute . "
I had no pity for these complacent victims .
The Oxfam man took pity on him and brought him a pair from stock .
He may have taken pity on her and bought her a drink , at the same time buying a little companionship for himself , easing the ache of his loneliness .
We took pity and gently replaced their roofs .
He felt no pity .
It was a sight which would have left some men feeling pity , but Urquhart felt a chilling emptiness .
Corbett felt pity but resolved not to weaken .
He felt a wave of almost incredulous pity for princes .
